QBEga5UwdeY6ug4BC20nAA.text: LOVE...LOVE...LOVE THIS SPOT.......BOMB TAZIKI!!!.....low maintance with low prices....and delicious. ...staff always keeps it clean and takes care of what you need......mom and pop place with what matters, customer service and delicious food...yum! Thank you

1Evst07k2D4pspW9D18ROQ.text: This is hands down my family's favorite Greek restaurant.  It's a family-run place in a strip mall but so, so much more than the location and the sparse decor.  The best way to sum up the place is what the lovely woman who works the counter once told my mother: "We make everything with love.  You have to make money to stay open, of course, but it's the love that keeps people coming back .  You can tell when there's love in the food."  I love the warmth of this place, Greek music and all.  The made-to-order gyros is the thing to get, a sandwich for a big meal and the plate for a huuuge meal.  The meat is hot and fresh (which is not always the case at Greek sandwich places) and the vegetables are crispy.  The fries are always piping hot.  The falafel is also great.  Eat here and eat here often.  Know that there's someone in SF that wishes he were in your place as you hungrily eye your neighbor's ramekin of tzaziki sauce...  Beware!  The place closes at 8 and sometimes by 7:30.  All good things...

OyZInXdf5vy6nH9rYyezcg.text: This is my favorite gyro place. The service is exceptional and friendly and the food is AMAZING! I usually go with a steak or chicken pita and it is consistently the best!!

EZ1KBZsc5BiZ0_YoYKwclw.text: The owners are like my second set of parents. They care about my family and always hope for our well being. Their food is amazing and you can tell they put their love into their cooking. It always tastes amazing. The gyro(euro) and chicken pita are godly. The dill sauce is also amazing. The only downside is I eat there so often I have to give my taste buds a break lol. Can only handle so much nostalgia and flavor as I've been here since we moved from Ohio 14 years ago. Go there, relax and eat.

yisNEiri975ku5XYWcTdCw.text: This place is good!!!  Made to order and authentic.   Greek chicken salad and hummus are a must try!

mF28JdfN5BLYMUM_X2iyFA.text: I'm not a huge Greek fan, probably because I don't like lamb gyros or pitas or whatever they want to call it.   But today I went in just get a chicken pita. I thought it would be like any other chicken pita but i was wrong. The chicken was very moist and the flavor was damn good. There sauce actually had good flavor to it since other places I've had we're very bland.   My friend got the chicken kabob plate, which for 8.99 was HUGE. He got a salad then a huge thing of rice, huge chunks of chicken and some toasted pita bread. Well worth it, this thing could probably feed 2 people.   The rice they have is great and the pitas were not over cooked/toasted.   The only draw back is during lunch it can get cramped in there and the Pepsi seemed alittle sweeter than it should be. But those are very small problems.   I would come back again when I'm in the area.

v3YpfJqGP8IrJ0rqdfaDvw.text: As the number of check-ins I have shows, i eat here a lot. And I never get bored of it!   The owners are super friendly, and they are always genuinely glad to see you when you walk in.   The Gyros are probably 2nd in the valley only to Haji-Baba in my opinion, but they are far from the best trick up the sleeve here!  Try the shish-kabob. Trust me, you won't regret it! Also, the souvlaki is amazing, and the dolmas are delicious!  Personally I get a gyro salad to go on my way home from the gym 9/10 times I come, but i also try to change it up and I've yet to come across something on their menu that wasn't delicious!

mA5cbowECSIFugZ8Sei3Qg.text: I've been to Greek restaurants all over the world and nothing compares to their tzatziki sauce.   Authentic Greek food run by a Greek family in a small and unassuming location.

SO3IOkyZcnNI7QkZqf8R3Q.text: Really they want to charge a $1.50 more to Substitute French Frys for a salad REALLY!  It costs them more for Frys  then it does for lettuce and Tomato. Every other Gyros place I've been to will substitute. NO LIE!    Good : they give a lot if gyros meat on gyros. Bad: it lacks tzatziki sauce and it's very oily Not impressed.

3f9kZLwNnE6iUP6XZz2zPw.text: Even though I've rarely had anything else on their menu except for hummus, I highly recommend this little greek hot spot. They have tons of regulars because the food keeps them coming back. The hummus is to die for (it only comes with one pita however, so I always order 2-3 extra). I have also tried their veggie gyro which is great. I have brought many meat-loving friends here and I've never heard anything but great things about their experience with their food.   The staff is completely Greek. They are friendly in their own unique kind of way. Because I usually saunter in with a drink from Starbucks (same parking lot), the female owner assumes I work there and she always asks me how business is going at SB. I corrected her the first few times, but she continued to ask, so now I just keep it going and tell her it's going great but that I hate my job (because I'm assuming I would, if I worked there). I love her personality...very intense. Never smiles, even when a smile would be just right. But she is still very kind. Always look forward to seeing her and eating her food.

b6QJmcPY_mJE0ZmZKS7p8Q.text: I've been come to King Gyros for years.  It's family owned and the lady who works the counter is always super nice.  The food is excellent. I know they add dill to it, but it's the best tzatziki sauce I've ever tried.

aeuhj3QLzzw946vkt5B8ow.text: This restaurant is awesome, I'm so glad I have discovered Yelp so I can brag a bit about it for all they do. ck-lIK2qRmcp0yNNUUQBoQ.text: If you're looking for an authentic, Greek, family owned experience....this is it!! The food is delicious, the hummus is made fresh daily, the tatziki sauce is soooo good. 4cDSifn5DwP40l9Egac_YA.text: Very good, clean atmosphere, Greek Salad was generous and tasty.

ilbJOYudFo-a-90v3fh3wg.text: The food was so delicious and you get a lot for your money! The lady at the cash register was really nice and considerate. w1pqunGXpO6BSMe4qD5w6w.text: My hubby and I decided to check this place out, since we were on this side of town and really wanted some gyros.  It came suggested to us by a co-worker of his, so we figured it would be delicious!  It wasn't...  It's a small place with about 8-9 tables, which I don't have any problem with.  If it's good, it shouldn't matter how big or small a place is.  We ordered our food and sat down.  The woman at the counter was quite nice and seemed very helpful.  We started with the hummus, which was wonderful.  That's the main reason I didn't give them 1 star.  The pita served with it was warm and soft.  We were really looking forward to our gyro combo meals, hoping this was a precursor to the rest of the meal.  Well, here I go...the gyros were hot and really full of meat.  My mouth was watering at the thought of biting into it.  Then, I did.  The tzatziki sauce didn't taste right.  It was all dill, and had no hint of a cucumber flavor, which I normally find so refreshing in a gyro.  Not only that, but it was so oily, it kept separating at the bottom of the pita.  Then, there's the meat.  I found it greasy and bland.  I like juicy gyro meat, but I also like when you get a bit of the crust from the outside.  I went to taste a bit of the crust, and it dripped grease on my finger and felt spongy.  It seemed very unappetizing.  I'm a meat-eater, and would usually have eaten every last bit of it, but I ended up pulling most of it out of the pita (which was the best part of it) and dipping it into the rest of our hummus.    And, finally, the fries on the side.  They were soggy, so I didn't eat any of them.  I've read over the other reviews, and I guess gyros really are a matter of taste.  We won't be returning here, and will keep going to our main gyro restaurant.  But, we also won't stop looking for other really good gyros around town.

a-qtQkEJXyZpvBEg4jK22w.text: I absolutely love this place. The owner is so friendly and remembers us (we come very often). I've had several things on the menu and have not been disappointed! My latest favorites are the souvlaki and chicken plates.

cDqyfawEqpElswqNl__hAg.text: King gyros is great. I stopped in last week and had a wonderful experience. This place truly lived up to the hype. I am extremely particular with my gyros and this did not disappoint.

-3oZIBqdB9jX4NjejYiGCw.text: Delicious!  Courteous. Family!  That's how you sum up King Gyros!    I've been going to King Gyros for over a decade.  They NEVER disappoint! ako-Nd6p3zOUmaYQd9Kmnw.text: I have been coming to this gyro shop for about 2 years. At first, the service seemed kinda formal and very "strictly business." However, after my third visit, the family that runs the restaurant began to recognize me and became friendlier. Now, I'm always greeted by smiling faces and questions about school, my family, and the like. They are fantastic people. Perhaps it is a cultural difference?   The food is what keeps me coming back. Absolutely in love with their gyros. The meat, veggies, and pita taste fresh and never over cooked. Fries are okay, nothing special but that doesn't bother me because I go for the gyros.   Overall, this is a great neighborhood spot run by a cool immigrant family.

j9GJzyDwliFIwKqpLTu-KA.text: If you have never had Greek food before then this might pass as decent. There are so many better options when it comes to Greek restaurants that only a few miles from here and are worth the money.   My husband order the Chicken Pita. The chicken was spongy as if had been sitting in a bucket of water.   My toddler and I shared the chicken kabob plate. The rice was extremely salty and tasted like Top Ramen rice. The chicken tasted old and was greasy.   We all shared an order of hummus, which was bland and was drowning in oil that created a less than desirable after taste.   I am glad this was not our first experience tasting Greek Food because it would have been our last. As for now we will stick to our fav. place down the street from here.   To end with a positive note, the salad veggies did taste fresh.

xrrkK2Fhrw9tmxOis1wVyA.text: I've been here many times, and the food and service are both always great! I've had the gyro as well as the salad, and they're both fantastic! It's a perfect spot for lunch with indoor or outdoor seating.

_3ssCw3ZjSuigVTYKPTzdA.text: The freshest salad you'll find in this area. Small family owned business. Great customer service.

TrUBXg0O0QzGPzfLfbZHIg.text: I can't believe I haven't thought to review this place before! It's a small strip center location with just about enough seating for a lunch rush. I've been going to this restaurant for years and think they have some of the best Greek food in the entire Valley. Especially their gyro. I have not had one better anywhere. The meat is always moist and delicious and you get tons of it whether you order the gyro sandwich, salad or plate. The pitas are soft and fluffy. The taziki is so flavorful you'll find yourself asking for extra just to make sure every bite is coated in it. It's a family-owned business that's makes you feel like family when you dine there. I always see lots of Greek people eating at this restaurant which is always a good sign! I took my 20 month old granddaughter to eat there twice in the last couple weeks and she demolished the gyro meat and all but ignored her french fries, which are good too, so you know it's got to be tasty.

3r92-ErxRRNiEFi-HI0ZAA.text: Best Greek in town.   We always get the chicken Greek salad.   Best salad I have ever had.   We go almost every weekend.  We found this hidden gem by accident.

e_wHXEtxQyx5FvLHug6URg.text: I had some time to kill so I decided to stop by this joint for lunch. Not a bad decision! their Falafel pita was delicious. I felt like a dine-in order would deserve better than a styrofoam plate and they certainly skimped on the fries on this occasion but the falafel was well cooked and the sandwich had a lot of fresh/pickled veggies included. FaZeVZ-3rnVcHs3Pckqm8g.text: This has been my favorite Greek place to eat for almost, wow, 12 years now. I first have to start with the great customer service I get every time I go there. I have brought friends and family here because of it (plus the food of course), and I get asked every time I go about how they are doing or about how my life is going. She remembers great details about her customers, and now-a-days that's a rare find. She knows exactly what I am going to order (Yes, I'm predictable) and has it already written on a ticket before I'm at the counter. Just amazing personable service.   Now to the food, which is just as amazing. If you enjoy a classic gyro, that's what got me hooked in the first place. The Tzatziki Sauce is flavorful, and sauce like, not thick, and has been the best I have tasted. I love getting an extra side and dipping my fries in it or pouring it on my rice. If you want to try something a little different get my favorite which is the steak pita. The steak is marinated in some delicious concoction,  and its won me for good. They have plenty of other options for people who aren't adventurous in the food category, like hamburgers and what-not, but I haven't had them. I would only imagine they are tastey if that's what you are going for ;)

61_T55D77O4kbO11NRT9fA.text: Best gyro place in town. Family owned with the owners homemade baklava. If you are coming here and it is close to closing. Call them and they will do the order over the phone so you won't miss out. Tons of meat and the sauce is the best. You have to get an order of baklava. The perfect flakey crunch but still moist with honey. It's addicting. You are warned.

TSQQ4x91kMsEqFHgyUnWbw.text: Best Greek food ever!  The owners are cool, too...  The sauces are awesome.  Quality is top notch.  This is a 5 star spot!

JBAyTv0EUAkw2rRvhpT0JA.text: Not only is the food amazing but the customer service is beyond belief. This family owned and operated restaurant could not have done it better not once but two days in a row. in addition I saw how personable they were with all of their customers remembering not only who they are but what they order. If you're in the area do not pass this place up!

9G3VRR4n6IaZSxfXMrvnkA.text: This place brings back many memories. Every time my family would go and get haircuts we would come here afterwards. This is the best place I have ever been to for gyro's. The family who owns it is very nice and are actually from Greece. The prices are very reasonable. This is my favorite place in the entire city to go for Greek food! Try them out, you will not be disappointed.

CQkyHDnDzyoi78ZOLRtfQw.text: One of the better assembled greek Chicken Pita's I have had in awhile. All the usual suspects were involved, but the chicken was spiced and sliced perfectly and tucked into a pita wrap with good dill sauce, lettuce and other veggies. The pita came with hot fries and was served by the nice female owner of the place. This was a random stop while working one day in the area. This is the only time I feel bad a restaurant is not a chain because it is far from East valley. It only costs seven bucks too and most patrons were talking greek, so you knew you were eating in the right place.

civEN_jM8wNJUJwHE3V4ZQ.text: This place is so good! The owners are very friendly and welcoming. The food portions and prices were great. The gyro pita was delicious! Coming back for sure.

hF1SKzttqM0vlwTIlXSZMA.text: Delish and great service. The gyros are very good. The folks who work here are very friendly. The Baklava is just okay, I have had better. I will definitely go back here more often. I live nearby and this was a new find for me.

1kRIvzwxToOWBhZYBwkDLQ.text: Trying to find the best Gyro spot in the west valley. I keep coming back here. The portions are big and the food is great. No reason to go anywhere else.

8XlnywS1X6ZAyc__Ct-hFQ.text: This place is perfect! I will come here every chance. I order the chicken Caesar salad, wow! Everytime I go all are happy.

rnBMR7PTJ4Sk99Yft8V6RQ.text: Excellent combo plate! Full of flavor and the chicken was especially amazing!! The tzatziki sauce is thick and creamy with lots if dill which I love!! Also the baklava is very buttery and flakey. Even the pita bread was buttery and toasted on the grill... I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good portions and full of flavor! Combo plate.
Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good portions and full of flavor!

rB4FeB6pHN-n1ZBDC9t4Cw.text: We've been eating here for 6 years and they've never disappointed. We love this place! Our usual are the gyro salad and chicken kabob plate and nobody beats theirs. Always great service and they get everything exactly how you order. Definitely a neighborhood gem!

MVAoGAKpNgz5Cd2ns-AZbQ.text: I love their chicken Cesar salad. Flavorful chicken and come with lots  of chicken! Their chicken teriyaki is good too. Who could imagine that we could get such a nice teriyaki chicken at Greek restaurant!?

n8LxAfQBT7AzcpRGRy7ZuQ.text: No time for a full review.  Just go here  Ok.  Now time for the review.   Why?  Because everything from the shawarma to the kabobs to the gyros is great.   Friendly family runs this place.   It fancy at all - it's a hole in the wall in an ordinary stop mall.  But sooo good

DGCEbVEl_SixV9AP8AvG1w.text: Absolutely delicious! I had the Gyros plate, my husband had the shawarma and chicken kabobs. The gyros was tender and so tasty, not to mention the HUGE portion you get. The salad it comes with was very fresh and crisp. The staff are very friendly and welcoming, I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9qFBsAqo0nC2OT2znqtzcQ.text: This was my 1st time here, and I was not disappointed.  It is not a huge space but the food is top notch. The lady, I believe is an owner is adorable.  I loved that as customers walked in, she said do you want your usual. Not just one person, like 10. She knew them and what they wanted. That is Customer Service! Had the gyro plate, came with a salad and fries. The salad was huge, and the fries were good. Their pita bread was delicious, I even bought more to take home. However the best thing about this place is the gyro meat. Omg it was moist and the flavor was wonderful.   I have went to many gyro places around the NW Metro Phoenix  area. This is by far the Best of them all.  We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu Board
Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad, Delicious

hdrq65erymSIZNjwS3jPXw.text: Well that was unexpected. The steak in the steak gyro was thick, tender chunks, perfectly seasoned and a generous portion. Place seemed pretty busy at 2 pm after the lunch rush, it sounded like many regulars. The woman at the front counter, maybe an owner, was very pleasant. I can't wait to back to try another thing on the menu.

-pJ7LR18TSOQHtObW6c3hA.text: This place was good, clean and quick! Fries were not the best but the gyro and Greek salad was amazing. I got it to go but would have gladly eaten inside as the atmosphere was pleasant and clean.

photos.caption: Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8BzQqmjIxd_jMTFKy_G0Xg.text: I had a falafel pita with a salad. The salad was so fresh and the pita was delicious! Great price, quick and friendly service, and most importantly delicious food.

wN8O0ENTKJLLq-BV6VNlyw.text: If i say King Gyros is the best gyro shop in valley ,it wont be an exaggeration.The staffs are very friendly and shop is very clean.

s1zEuWU7rzQQEy1QgyDmng.text: Excellent food!! Great service!! Best baclava in this universe!!! If you're looking for Greek food, this is the place to be. The meat is perfectly seasoned and the owners are very nice people.

kmiPw22hQujARIz-sUMQ9Q.text: Yum! Came here because of the reviews and the king delivered! This place has a following, the regulars noticed it was our first time and assured us all the food was good and fresh made, they were really passionate about this place. I ordered the falafel pita and my husband got the classic gyro. Owner was so friendly and welcoming. The place has a very warm feel and was totally packed with happy customers.  Food came out at a good pace and was delicious! Very authentic and fresh taste, big portions and big flavor. Even ordered some falafels togo becuase they were so good and the owner was kind enough to give me their house made hummus with it for free because she said it tastes better together. Loved this place.  I will be returning to eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Falafel pita w fries, amazing!
Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad and classic gyro, nice portion!
Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Owner is so nice

pxOoBr47r5bwTTP9w7O5jw.text: Best Gyros in the State! I have been eating here for YEARS, and can't say enough great things. People drive from far southeast Valley it's so amazing. I always get gyros value meal with salad instead of fries, don't forget the baklava!

photos.caption: Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_HMmvjEEQrpIMO8gNHpkZg.text: I love this place. Authentic yummy food !! The service is always perfect and they care if anything is wrong. She double checks everything before she gives us our Togo order. Even when the line is out the door the service is still pretty speedy and still quality food!

xPlmrtNPlFvKLaNiAhB_pQ.text: I'm this place is AMAZING!!!! If you like gyros get here! Best tzatziki I have EVER had.  Definitely a family recipe- not a generic pre package.  The veggies are fresh and cut thick (so is the meat!) This place does not cut corners!!!

lO_n7JOZIfnkXQdY30x_lg.text: Lucky to find one so close in the neighborhood. The food is well priced and good. They also accept carry out by phone which is a plus.

uTR7j8_yrdef3m7c4CZtkw.text: I love chicken gyros and this place is one of my favorites! So good! Definitely check it out!I always dip my fries in the Tzatziki sauce. Yum!

S4z_hemmoSleNQ7oXe4V9Q.text: Great food! Hard to find a place to sit in the small dining area during busy times, but otherwise pretty good.

W1STmt6n3Ot01ysI3jHQqQ.text: I come here for my gyros.  My nephew from Chicago (when he visits us) goes for the falafel as he is vegetarian.  I order the #8 gyro plate  with two extra pita and an extra tzaki sauce.  I have it for two days.  Beware though, the olive in the greek salad is not pitted, oh well.  I enjoy the food and the prices aren't too bad.  I tried a couple other places including a local really very middle eastern and they weren't very good.  I love this place.

PkDVOMoe5Sec1z-8jBijqw.text: I have been going to King Gyros for about seven years now.   The owner's wife is very nice to my two children, and remembers what they like (and what we like) when we walk in the door. I've never encountered something on the menu i did not like.   My wife regularly has the chicken pita I tend to gravitate to the the gyros plate, served with a salad while the kids have the chicken nuggets.   Portions are great.   When family comes in from out of town, it is a must have on their list as well.   To be honest, I pass 3 other pita places on the way there and never think twice about going to the other places.

Sexgms6m-MAP-Y0XgiD2rg.text: Awesome!!!!!  I had the gyros, then I could smell the kabobs.  I need to come back soon.

D6mwj7ArQ39Wg9fEFWdkDw.text: I like this laid back gyro place! I ordered the gyro combo, it came with a gyro sandwhich, fries and a soda. It was reasonably priced at $6.75. My boyfriend ordered the gyro plate. It came with a huge salad and it was $8.60 which did not include a soda. I enjoyed this gyro restaurant and will visit again! :)

TSq7dbB16f0mdNzA5jXnZQ.text: This place has the worst greek food I've ever tasted. The meat was nasty and tasted like spam, the rice tasted like rice-a-roni, and the sauce was just gross. On the positive side, the lettuce was green and was as expected. Seriously, the only thing they got right was the lettuce.  Do yourself a favor and try another place for greek food.

_56tEWaBhQcipr3UJZ6Yxw.text: the chicken fajita pita plate is huge and always a good choice...

nYpYm-cZpdpZ9Rj65MTeFg.text: I fully agree with Amanda B. on this one. Overall, mediocre at best. Hopefully you have one of their little coupons too, because they are a little overpriced. JT Gyros has this place beat by a mile.

bPdx4wpiWJLfz5OsQ_BLXg.text: Don't let its unassuming strip-mail location throw you off: this is one of the better places to eat in Phoenix. Everything is extremely fresh and very tasty. The Greek salads (with or without meat) are wonderful. Fresh sauces, lemon juice, and juicy tomatoes are at odds with the styrofoam plates and plastic utensils.  The colorful and friendly personalities of the staff are right out of a Seinfeld episode. The owner and his wife are frequently interacting with the customers to make sure that your meal is satisfying to you palate. Home cooking and conviviality are the trademarks of this diamond in the ruff.

KnRbnSOtvTLv0OBQH13k9w.text: Ok, this is a limited scope review based on the sirloin gyro and the friendly, family service alone, having no experience with the rest of the menu.  I see no need for there being any "rest of the menu".  Passed this place a dozen times over the past several years but wasn't hungry/wasn't meal time  or they were closed, but finally was passing by at mealtime, starving - and they were open.   I don't know how "authentic" a "sirloin gyro" is - I don't care - it is without a doubt the absolute best gyro I've ever had.  I've paid more for others in settings with more of that "sophisticated ambience" bidness, but this place has its own "family-run lunch counter" lack of pretentiousness, including the Greek travel posters that's an ambience in it's own worthy right.  But that joyous gyro - man, that thing is good! Stuffed full and absolutely overflowing with strips of incredibly tasty marinated beef - never had one quite like it.  Friendly folk behind the counter brought food to our table outside the front door - inquiring as to how good it was -with clearl pride in product.  Came w/fries which were fine - but that sirloin gyro - mmm - makes this little place worthy of being your destination rather than an afterthought when in the hood.

d6Vl3uBZmrW0Vn2rUrH_fQ.text: I love this place. I've only had the gyro here, and it's amazing.  I'm afraid to try anything else because I don't think I'd like it as much as the gyro! If I wasn't so poor I'd go here every week (seeing as how the gyro is only $5, it must mean I'm REALLLLY poor!)

yaFLC6c-t_EK8X1JL-ItPw.text: King Gyros was decent, though everything seemed a bit on the oily side.  Had a gyro with good tzatziki, hummus which was okay, and onion rings :) I suppose it's all about expectations, being a Chicago gal I will fully admit a high standard when it comes to gyros.  Since there are better gyro places within a short drive of here I likely won't return to King-Chicago Gyros is still my fave with JT's a close second.

CtHn1DSPwlPlqIwCEzwGKQ.text: While waiting to get a tattoo at Lucky Draw, the boys in the shop said they were ordering from here and asked if I wanted to go in on it. Sure, I said, not expecting anything spectacular but needing sustenance for the 3+ hour tattoo I was about to get.   What a surprise! I'm judging on the one meal that I had but Holy Sheep the Veggie Pita is to die for, Veg lovers!  The veggies tasted fresh and yummy and not all mushy. The red sauce, I'm not sure what it is but will have to find out, was so dang flavorable.   The flavor? Amazing. My taste buds were ecstatic.  If they can make a near-vegetarian girl happy and they're not even a vegetarian restaurant, I imagine the omnivores will make out like bandits here as well. New fan for life and very glad there is actually another decent veg-friendly restaurant on the West Siiii----eed!!!  UPDATE: The next time I went, it was just like a curry sauce, no red sauce. Huh? Not as tasty

8fErdCZd09OXSj7-kmpOCw.text: I have tried this place a few times now. The first time I went, the lady behind the counter talked to us and told us about the different dishes. She offered a generous sample of the gyro meat with the tzatki (sp) sauce. I never liked lamb, but this was very tasty! My family has ordered assorted dishes, of the assorted meat plate with rice and veggies, soulvaki, pork pita, steak sandwhich/pita,and I had the chicken pita and the chicken salad. The food here is fresh and home made. I love the sauce and always end up getting extra. The bread is wonderful and I would order a second pita for an extra .70 cents! All the meat was perfectly seasoned, juicy and delicious. The vegetables were fresh and no sign of browing. The place is a casual atmosphere and clean. I learned the lady's name is Oiudad and although she seems stern, she is very nice, the more she gets to know you she warms up. By the end of our last visit, my 26 yr old stepson gave her a big hug. We tried the home made baklava and it is out of this world delicious! This will be a spot we will return to over and over. They even have chicken nuggets, pasta, and hamburgers for the not so adventurous or kidlets to please everyone. I do wish they would get some brewed iced tea to add on the drink menu. That would be the only thing I would change.  But I can overlook that for this gem!

c8CTZDQg3JPAo3y02W2n9g.text: It was the number and quality of the reviews that brought me here. I am in the area a lot and didn't know they were here and that was my loss. Whenever I go to a Greek or Mediterranean restaurant, I go for the hummus and falafel first before I decide to get anything else. I order a side order of falafel to taste them without any sauce or anything to interfere with the flavor. The hummus was good but it was the falafel that was really good. I have been to some places where it's just a small, hard and dry hockey puck. These were a generous size (.50 cents each when I got them a la carte with my hummus). They were fried crispy, but were light with a great texture and taste. I can't wait to come back and have them in a pita; and I look forward now to their other dishes. Great little place; glad I found them.

uIcu7D8T9Zz47s4jRVw79w.text: This is definitely my favorite place to come for a gyro. The owner is a total sweetheart and already knows my order when I come in. Delicious!

96Sxb9ZdKkpJprC7NABAxA.text: Honestly this is one of the best Gyro's I have ever had. I get the Gyro platter which provides you with a lot of meat. I have not had a bad experience here yet. My wife even likes their cheese burgers.

f2eSx5YV-i5W2YDBaep7Cw.text: I have to agree w/ Becky S and Adam K....REALLY Good Middle Eastern food, good prices- nice staff! All-around winner!! best deal- 6.99 Gyro plate; giant gyro, fries and a drink!!! ..What more can you ask for.. (maybe a bigger sitting area!!)

2YQRbdfzmqyibuwyBlj3hQ.text: I have to say good greek food is hard to find their souvlaki and their gyro platters are the way to go!  The lady who runs the shop is super nice and she says they are a chicago style greek place.  I have not had greek food in Chi-town but having worked in greek diners, bakeries etc. They hold it down over here.  I usually order to go but they have a small seating area go enjoy this diamond in the rough.

3YAlkS3eqYopvTG88_kKDA.text: Everything on the menu rocks.Chicken kabob plate = amazing! The food here is fantastic. Mom and pop place. The wife is ringing up orders while the husband is kicking out dishes on the fly. Been coming here for years, never a dull meal.

PXg0yvsuDboTgA2wrc-3WQ.text: My most favorite pasta next to my grandma's. My husband loves the suvlaki plate. My 5 year old will eat everything off both our plates! Go! Go! Go!

o607alUB1PFA1Sx1_I6GvQ.text: Great food, great prices, large portions. This is by far the best Greek food I've ever had! It's a family run business and they are very sweet, makes me feel like I'm at home. You honestly can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

q_ttbakK4b8VDOV2eglMrQ.text: I love this place enough to spend 75% of my lunchtime driving to get to it on occasion. Everything I have tried is absolutely delicious! I've had the gyro salad, and the grilled chicken salad.  Mmm mmm good! The sauce they use is very flavorful, and the pita bread is great.

tdpt497coAKhlmsvt-TRSA.text: I ate the "Value Gyros Meal" which consisted of a Gyros, fries and a fountain drink.. The fries were fresh and well done with no greasy taste.. the fountain drink was fine... but I came for the Gyros and what can I say.. the portion was ample but the meat was lacking in taste and a good gyro's got taste.. and as they say.."the Chef is in the sauce" and honestly the yogurt and cucumbers were barely discernible on the gyro.. Having lived in the area of Tarpon Springs, Florida for 25 years I ate a lot of good gyros and this was not one.. There are better ones in the Valley..

2VMUpi1b-LunUPcae27FBw.text: Wow, so good Mom and I ate  take out twice this week for lunch !!!  The Gyros were done  very well, ready for pick up and the salads are tasty. Their bread is great  even eaten alone .

e2r5_zNwNu4kVBnpFRv0AQ.text: I dropped by King Gyros after reading the raving reviews about this place. Now I know why! Their gyros are delicious and super cheap. It's kind of a hole in the wall place, but that made me even more fond of it. The staff was very friendly. I wish I lived closer to this place - it would definitely become one of my regular joints!

q2y2KG1S5-pUeoEYs9z0pQ.text: SO... I was TRYING to diet a little...lol that is a joke! I wanted a great salad. It being the first time I had tried it I was expecting  a bunch of greens and hardly any meat....lol I was greatly mistaken. SO MUCH GYRO MEAT... So tender! So much for my diet! Fantastic flavoring, tender amazing.... Short wait time for the food. My hubby got the gyro plate. (oh yea they also give you pita for your salad!) He was so stuffed after 1 gyro he couldn't  eat anything else that night! It was so great we decided to make it a bi-weekly destination. To anyone that wants a great meal, try them.

fmdGgCvAcdKucNsME4IyZw.text: Where to start???  The owners are very kind... say hi to Benny in the kitchen!!!  My wife and I found this place while living in the culinary-void NW Valley of Phoenix, and we have eaten here probably 50 times over a 3-year period.  Everything is good:  Gryos Chicken Pita Souvlaki Greek Salads are probably one of the best salads that we have ever eaten Fries are always fresh Zatsiki sauce is stellar  The atmosphere is a bit void, but people don't come to 35th and Thunderbird for the atmosphere...  they come for great food at a great price.

U_IwOYSQNtDj0AKqJkC2KA.text: The first place I've ever tried Greek food was Pita Jungle and I've been hooked ever since. However I have found that the mom and pop places can be a hit or miss. King Gyro's is a HIT .  I have had their tabouli, hummus, dolmas, chicken gyro, and fajita pita and never once have I been dissappointed.  NATHAN S was not exaggerating about the tzaziki sauce I eat it with EVERYTHING!

rRWSvhZTcCEnEXB3xKUYMQ.text: This place is great! Its a bit small and does get crowded at certain times, but the service is very good and the food comes out quickly. speaking of the food, its great! and is reasonably priced. I love to get the gyro platter here, its so good! and very filling! So if your hungry for gyros definitely check it out!

E8U3is1LxnDtPJ4PMc1ydw.text: Tasty, delicious, yummy, cheap ... I'm sold! Everything I tried was good, place is always packed, people are nice, what else do you need! I'm a big fan.

WgieACBR4KqFMrJfK-yeHQ.text: The very best gyro shop in the price range. The staff is amazing and remembers me after my first visit. Gyro is good but chicken is great

UN3RtQS7nVBmAlcbhVOMCA.text: Authenic, delicious green food. They use quality ingredients and make their food fresh. Family owned and operated. What a gem.

4byLTLgJqsubp34rDepUfQ.text: Disappointed with the quality. The gyro meat was very bland, soggy with grease, and chewy. I thought all Greek gyros were the same for the most part, but this was far below average. They were not polite at all, not coming here again..

WLpTZNKnH638JCJt7XcErw.text: Great food! Prices so reasonable, too. I'm so glad to live less than a mile away. The female owner is really cool, too. At first, she seems a bit no nonsense but I've managed to strike up conversations with her while waiting and she's as sweet as pie once you get to talking with her. A great family owned local business that will not disappoint!!! Their menu is huuuuuge, not just gyros. Italian, sandwiches, pastas, appetizers and more. If you want really great food, eat here!

lGuuVSrI99BllORwJO-wPg.text: Fantastic service, friendly staff and great food.  I have been here twice and highly recommend it for great Greek and Italian food.

D3syOCeHDeULy84DyFL08w.text: This place is a gem. Authentic fresh Mediterranean food. Everything on the menu is great. Try the steak pita or Gyros platter.  You will not be disappointed.

CGzavJDFe7nO6K_yTAwngA.text: This place is a family favorite. One of my parents used to go as a kid everyday so the employees know him, and of course us now. This is a cute little family owned Greek restaurant and the family there is so humble. I can go in and ask for my usual and she remembers not only my order, but the four other members of my families order as well. I absolutely love Benny. He's such a sweet humble man, god bless him.

CFi9HoQPjGDuDrbFGXUXRg.text: Been enjoying King Gyros dishes for over 15 years. Their delicious food is consistently fresh, tasty, perfectly seasoned. My favorite is the Gyros Platter, which (unlike most Gyros eateries) comes with two pitas and a lot of Gyros meat. I dislike French fries so King Gyros will substitute them with a second salad in the Gyros Platter. I LOVE this restaurant!

LIkw-4bQ5ERpZrD54C7Lzw.text: I freaking love this place!  The food is phenomenal, the owners are rad! This place is about as legit and authentic as you can get!  Excellent Greek food at reasonable prices.  Seriously, go there.  You won't be disappointed!

CZJhoBfLcD_igC7wwdtd_A.text: Our first time trying this place.  Friendly staff. We ordered a gyro sandwich and a hot dog and fries. The gyro sandwich was very tasty. The hot dog was just a hot dog. The food was hot and fresh.

4H6CjMnFHOtAvX4S107aJg.text: This is probably my favorite place to grab a chicken pita! As soon as I walk in, the lady at the register is so welcoming. The chicken is always prepared perfect and tastes so freshly grilled! Not only do you get. Chicken pita but there's a side of fresh fried fries. Can't get any better than that!

AdgMXv_XJRaXAO7knPMtEQ.text: The gyros are the BEST in the Valley! We love the service and the family atmosphere. The prices are awesome too, great value!

WX56usnNRsdwDTiMGWgDPA.text: Very nice place, family owned and operated.  The food is very good.  Service is fast and the people are very nice.  Very clean at a good value.  The Gyro combo meal was great.  Also highly recommend the steak pita.

kI0XWMIrqqHM3xQN0BJrGg.text: Wonderful food for a great price. If you order chicken expect to wait a few extra min. The front counter woman is stern and no nonsense. But this place is by the far top 3 I've had in the valley.

5qttCiFkXqWqZtFT2MxB7w.text: Love, Love Love the food and the staff, Perfect as always  Thank yoiu for a great hot meal on a cold windy night.

ELbgR7L3MqzoI3WzwZgZTw.text: First time at King Gyros, I hate to disagree with some of the other reviews I just read, but the lady (the owner I think) behind the register is not as friendly as said. However, I ordered the chicken pita and it was delicious except the pita was too hard and burned. Over all I believe this place deserves 3 stars in comparison to other Greek restaurants like Queen Greek.

6Rtecor8PiP4FSW5ngTCHQ.text: It seems people like this place a lot.  I happened to be making one of my rare trips to this side of town for a doctor's appointment and as part of my quest to discover the wealth of little mom & pop restaurants in the Phoenix area this one popped up in my Yelp search.  I've had some good Gyros and some really awful ones but I'm always open to try something new.  The place itself is pretty plain, in a strip mall with a couple of small metal tables on the sidewalk. Nothing fancy about it. The man at the counter who I'm guessing is the owner's son was nice and an older man, who I'm guessing is the owner, came around to all of the tables to chat. It looks like they get a high percentage of return customers.  I like that there is only one size fountain drink at one set price. I ordered the Gyros with a drink and was automatically given fries. The fries are good but if I had known they were included I would have asked for a side salad or nothing at all ... not a big fries eater.  Suggestion to them is to ask if the customer wants fries.  The Gyros itself is traditional (thankfully) with much more meat than most places serve. The other traditional ingredients include onions, fresh tomato and tzatziki, no lettuce.  The biggest difference is the meat, which is dry and flavorless at so many Greek restaurants. Here it is moist, thick and very flavorful.  My taste buds tell me they use lamb, which has a distinctive taste. Their meat comes from Kronos in Chicago which pretty much has a lock on wholesale Gyros meat distribution.  If you are not in the mood for Gyros this place has a pretty eclectic menu ranging from hamburgers and hot dogs to spaghetti and even catfish filet.  I like and encourage mom & pop restaurants and always try to support them with my business. That doesn't always mean I'll come back if the food or service is bad. King Gyros has their act together and I know I'll be back next time I'm in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of King Gyros - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;A&#34; for artful presentation, it&#39;s served looking like a magazine ad.

ke0ZPbCFRhGQbZHByob3zA.text: Gyros=Yee Row  I was looking for a lunch alternative and happened on to King Gyros in Phoenix, located in a strip mall. From the outside King Gyro doesn't look like much, and you need to park around the corner in the strip mall parking lot. However, the inside of King Gyro is very clean, well kept, and inviting.    I'm a huge Gyro fan and insist the word is  pronounced Yee Row. On this visit my lunch companion and I ordered a Steak Gyro and Chicken Cesar Salad, and both entree's were delicious.   The Steak Gyro was huge and filled with meat, this Gyro was big enough to feed two. The sauce was perfect, not too tart and the bread was fresh, warm and delicious. The Chicken Cesar Salad was also very good.  The chicken was moist and flavorful.  The lettuce was fresh and crisp, and the dressing flavorful.  I would go back there everyday if I lived in that area.

VpIKAhZUFO54EV9mvY1WzA.text: Being from Chi-Town and living in AZ since '01 I've had my share of Greek food and must say that King Gyros is not only authentic, it's REALLY AUTHENTIC! Had the Combo with Kiftka, Gyros meat, and Chicken... All three were delicious, served warm, moist and seasoned properly... My taste buds were screaming MORE!   My wife told me to slow down because I must have been shoveling every forkful into my kisser... But how can you stop or slow down on this food? YOU CAN'T!!! The chicken broth infused basmati rice,salad,and pita with side of tzatziki sauce were also great.   The owners made you feel like you are welcomed in their home(restaurant)... If you like or love Greek or Mediterranean food this is a must... You will thank me later!

aURGt8x0mnRkc7Mw0auTag.text: Best Gyro place in the valley run by the sweetest family! Can't say enough good things about this place. Trust these reviews, if you eat here I guarantee you won't be going to another gyro place in Phoenix.

X39c_t6VAdoJt7HZMtsNpA.text: Have been here twice so far and both times, food and service were excellent. Chicken pita sandwich (comes with fries) and the gyros plate (comes with salad, bread, and fries) are amazing. Their plates are very, very filling so you'll have enough to take to go if you'd like. Small and quaint place with a friendly atmosphere. Would definitely recommend!

Kh-z39o5whsjM9ACb98VdQ.text: My wife and I love this place. We use to go there all the time when we lived over that way. Just went there after about a year away and the food is still great. Hummus with Greek pitas are the best around.

Ia87E53MNWgdqQ0KVtYwGQ.text: I ate here three times in a week...  That's how much I love this place.  I get the regular gyro, and I cant tell you enough how delicious the food is here.   It's a small little shop across the parking lot from Pure Fitness.  If you dont look for it, you can miss it.    I havent tried other foods, but what i have eaten, has been amazing.  Im sure I will go here again this week and look forward to maybe something new.

niXAth_gf0hIzDqCb7dHKw.text: I just put a review in here for this place and now I need to add an update. Do not go here, they are unprofessional and rude. I called them today around noon to find out when they close being Christmas eve. I was told 4pm so I planned to be there around 3:30 to pick up some gyro sandwiches for myself and my mother. I arrived at 20 minutes till and parked in front. When I stepped out of the car the owner stepped out and said they were closed. This to me is not the way to run a business. I said it was not 4pm yet and he didn't say much then just walked back in the store. Damn rude if you ask me. Puts me off from going back to this place and I will not recommend it to anyone. Makes me wonder if the lost business was worth going home 20 minutes early.  "Update" I went in to King Gyros a few days ago mostly because my mother loves the meat here. Right when I walked in The owner in the back started yelling at the women behind the counter. I was thinking he must read yelp and realized I was the one who gave him a bad review. Turns out he was telling the woman to give me a free gyro because they were closed when I arrived on Christmas eve. He told me he remembered me and apologized for being closed. I would say they redeemed themselves in spades. I now will recommend them and go back.

rOj5_P87WT2eekv_nRo8fw.text: I have always been surprised/dismayed as to how difficult it is to find good greek food in Phoenix.   Well, here you go. I will admit that I am a bit of a Gyro junkie and have not tried anything else on the menu, but this is my go-to place for greek food. I have been known to drive 20 minutes out of my way just to pick up a gyro from this place.  Great Food - Friendly Staff - Clean = What more can you ask for?

66ywkbFKsg_1IA03dK_JSg.text: When it comes to Greek Food there is a hierarchy:  - Authentic Greek food that is made in the Mediterranean and you immerse yourself in the culture by assisting in the slaughter of the lamb yourself. - Chicago style Greek food where your meal has been touched by every member of the Greek family that owns the restaurant. - King Gyros - Places that try to be King Gyros - You at home, throwing shit that could go into a gyro into a tortilla (because you think they are the same,) but oddly now it looks like a burrito...   Reasons King Gyros gets 4 stars from me:  + It's close to my house and my job. + For the quality and quantity of food you get the price is excellent. + The service is fast and friendly. + They have amazing dishes other that just gyros! -  The dolmades were not that hot... I have had fresh dolmades and also those from a can and these... I suspect were from a can. I can't confirm that, but I have a high suspicion...

VCuUgLJpbEtR-tqDuvHTQw.text: Greek mafiosos aside, I find King Gyros to be a good cheap lunch grub type of place.    It's a counter style lunch joint (wedged in the Mervyn's shopping center) with tacky Greek beach posters on the wall, classroom carpet, corian tables and cedar chairs.   I come here quite often and usually order a chicken gyro plate with fries or the greek salad, and they're both tasty, cheap and does the job.  In particular I like the gyro sauce with its yogurt sauce, spices and fresh dill.    King Gyros is not exactly a standout type of place, but I find it to be a solid choice if you're in the area.  It can get busy during the day, but last time I was here Nico and Demetri rolled up with their entourage in their club clothes and a pricey Mercedes at 2 PM.  Klassy!

VtWZGq1R0mE3_Q1eOMjyrQ.text: Greatest gyros in town!   Paul C. and myself tried one of the more expensive, fancier, Rep rated trend joints and there was no comparison.   What they lack in atmosphere they make up for with delicious food and great service!   One time I spilled tzaziki sauce on my shoe and nearly ate it without thinking...that's how good the stuff is.   They would be the perfect sunday lunch place if only they were open on Sunday.

txix8w1iv0ToSwT8P9Uqxg.text: Love it!  I only have ordered the special number 1 which I like a lot and have not tried anything else!

zmDQMklrD1ST1OSHm7Wv3g.text: This place is great.  Expect a bit of a wait during lunch time because it will be busy.  There's only a few tables inside this small restaurant so I recommend take out if you can.  One of the best gyros I've had and definitely the best on the west side.  Their prices are reasonable.  Two huge gyros, both with fries, and one fountain drink ends up being about $13.  The rest of the menu looks really good, but the gyro is so good I can't get myself to order anything other than that.

NxR7fDUrRv3hLYnWE8VkQA.text: This is the spot to get Gyros when I'm in AZ (will be back there in a few days).  I've been going here every time I visit for the last few years and it's been very consistent.  The same owners, same great food and service.  I've tried almost everything and the only complaint (if you can call it that) was when I got the Gyros salad, there was TOO MUCH meat on it.  Definitely a place I can trust when taking a friend to get some gyros for the first time..

ffyUTTcULCS_YnPEZFhn8A.text: Just came from this mom and pop restaurant. Unbelievable! We've tried several highly rated Mediterranean restaurants throughout the valley and this has surpassed them by far. The woman who owned it was so sweet, a Grecian grandma who cared about us. The gyro platter was sooooo addictive. The meat was juicy, tender, and seasoned perfectly and the tzasiki was amazing- complemented the meat beautifully. The pitas were warm and fresh- best I've had. The hummus was oh so garlicky. Smooth and perfectly made. Kids had some yummy hot dogs with fries made fresh. Go here- you will not regret it. We can't wait to try the rest of their extensive menu!

o3PwQKfq1vW4xMvV5prKoQ.text: The food here is good, pipping hot, fresh, and not over spiced or sauced. Location and food prices are great for all you ASU West Campus students, so go take a walk off campus for a change and stop eating in that thing they call a cafeteria! Service and the staff here are great people, make sure to tip handsomely because of this. Although the space to eat is minimal during lunchtime.   Today, a huge family decided to take up half of the restaurant, which was very awkward for other patrons. I took my meal to-go today, but sitting in normally isn't too bad. Its not much to look at, but they're for the most part sanitary and efficient at the food and service part.

JGtQ-wyxVqWPuypJWqtIkA.text: I have only the regular gyro but it was really good and a really good price for a quick lunch break from the office.

NpuLoRAOqWjzVyldxYk29A.text: My husband and I love this place. The chicken pitas are our favorites. The house made gyro/tzatziki sauce is the best I've ever had.   Prices are very reasonable and everyone is very friendly. This place is definitly worth the trip if you're looking for a laid back atmosphere and tasty food!

BmvSUD9XAulQ_YPkkC901w.text: Family and I cannot get enough of this place, we all love the gyros.  Owner is super friendly and if she recommends something try it you will not be disappointed; unless your just plain picky.

2etqlx6tUC2u4kyqQb-D5w.text: I love this place-probably the best Greek food in town and its evidenced by how busy it always is.  The family knows their customers, they have my favorite items memorized and if I get an order to go for lunch at work, they are fast and very friendly.  Very very tasty, and even better that its not a commericialized place, their advertising is stricly word of mouth.  This is a small business restaurant run very well.

xuQQAIqsyheJ5tPGmzZtnA.text: I have been going to King Gyros for over a decade now.  It is hands down the best Greek Food I have ever had.  The Gyro meat is fantastic.  I tend to like mine a little over done.  They know that, and never miss getting it right.  The hummus is the best in Phoenix, the tzatziki sauce is insane.  The restaurant is always spotless.  Best of all are the owners and staff.  This restaurant is clearly their passion and they are so attentive to their customers.  In fact, after getting divorced, they asked my interest in another very cute customer.  She said she would put in a good word for me if interested.  What other restaurant does that?  Love this place!

6IXfduIi6alFI-6leM2L_Q.text: I've tried them all and this is the best Gyro in all of Phoenix.  Big, meaty portions, Tzatziki Sauce made w/ Greek yogurt~not sour cream.  This is a family~owned restaurant.  My wife and I have been coming here for years & will continue to as well.

cdAp718Y0L-clf2BOvIqYA.text: Best food and BEST service. The owner is very friendly and you feel like you have known here for years. LOVE LOVE the food too!!

oje6gk70Yb8Wgj05mWRIFQ.text: solid gyro fantastic price great service lots of parking air conditioned excellent chicken 5/5  thanks,  -big marc

Please don't forget to add extra Tzatziki as your taste buds will thank you. It is our go to spot for Greek food. And don't forget to notice their "A" rating from the health department posted on the wall. They deserve a visit.

SxVnxiUNTHxBXTaCh_oprA.text: Place was very good. My friend brought me here for lunch and even though they were busy they remembered his order and exactly how he likes his food. 3mgrM7JY5ZbzgCxIvkuoyA.text: I was having a major craving for a Greek salad and my parents mentioned they had been here a few times and really loved their food. I decided to give them a try. Boy, am I glad I did! The restaurant is small and located in a strip mall. When I walked in there was a counter to walk up to and put in your order. I decided on the chicken Greek salad. I had a seat and waiting patiently for my food. There are a few tables inside so you have the option for dine in or take out. It was takeout tonight. I only was waiting about 5 minutes or so if that and I was on my merry way with my salad in tow. I got home and there is a pita sitting on top of the salad. I lift that off to reveal a salad from the gods above. Seriously the dressing on this salad is AMAZING! I don't know what is put in it but it was the most delicious salad I have ever tasted. It was Romain lettuce, tomato, kalamata olives, bell pepper, red onion, cucumbers, feta and grilled chicken that was seasoned to perfection! Oh and cannot forget that house dressing. It was a big salad and I gave the pita and half the salad to my dad. We were both full after but thankfully not that overly stuffed feeling. This could be bad because I have a feeling I will be coming here often and at $10 a salad that will add up. I will definitely be back soon and will be trying other things on the menu. I can't wait until my next King Gyros fix!!!

pDTiNMR5ceq_awiWVqo0gQ.text: This place is my favorite place to eat Gyros in all of Az--it's always the good local small spots that have the best food! Tucked in a shopping center, this place is definitely worth a visit for lunch or a quick bite with friends and family!   I ordered the gyros sandwich because DUH it's KING gyros! You get a choice of side, usually fries or Greek Salad with it. I go for fries when I feel like indulging but this last time I got salad and omg it was so good! I love having olives and feta in my salad. I really want to get onion rings but haven't so far. Definitely will try next time as a side.    The gyros was amazing--cooked well, seasoned perfectly and delicious! It comes with onions and tomatoes and I also got it with extra tzatziki  sauce and I definitely recommend you doing the same. That way you can pick at a couple of gyros and dip in one sauce so your sandwich is easier to fold and take bites of. I pour the extra sauce on the remainder of my sandwich. I added some feta in my sandwich and I really loved it!   Can't wait to come back here again! My man loves the catfish special too he says it's one of his favorite dishes here!

B_UnpeqLm2sxK0Vzu9XHpQ.text: OUTFREAKING STANDING, GREAT FOOD, GREAT STAFF Today I went in for the first time, the staff was friendly, the guys in the kitchen offered me a plate of thier gyros meat to sample and it was so good. 24 yrs in business and You dont stay in business that long without being OUTSTANDING. Okay I had the Gyros salad It was huge, delicious and Wowed even me. I have been vary picky in my choices for Gyros and This Wonderful Little family owned and operated  Restaraunt has just become my absolute favorite ..

J6PXsyXVnQG1x2z-qLpMaw.text: Stopped in recently because it was closer than our usual gyro spot & while the gyros were good, they were not as good as what we usually have a little further away. The meat was delicious although a little saltier & that's pretty much all they use for the gyro. We prefer them with lettuce, onions, tomatoes & a nice sauce. Ours had hardly any onion & no vegetables at all. The taziki sauce was more of a paste or spread & also hardly there. The meat did taste good & there was a lot of it. The fries were ok, but a little on the soggy side...same for their onion rings. We wouldn't rule out trying them again, but would definitely try something else there.

73PE3w3s2XQAq_7INIZo2w.text: Been coming here for years.  It's the best Gyro joint I've been to.  Family own and operated.  Always super clean, fast service, big portions and best of all great tasting foods. And they are super friendly.  They treat you like family.

vjxbijCUrGo9N-Hf_4pSXA.text: I have been coming to this restaurant for many years, and the food and service is always consistent. I highly recommend the chicken pita or the gyro! Also, their tzatziki sauce is THE BEST I HAVE EVER HAD!   Lunch is pretty busy, but if you call ahead it will be ready in about 15 mins or less! Also, the prices are perfectly in budget to splurge on once a week!

XxHgNupXXqNcFW1SESM6Hw.text: Stopped by for lunch with my son after we were informed the they were also the owners of Pepper sauce our favorite lunch destination down by my office.  We walked in and were immediately greeted by the owner.  Very nice.  Son and I both had the Gyro combination, I had mine with Rice and Aidan had his with FF.  Let me tell Yoh they were very good and the Tzatziki was outstanding.  We will definitely be returning!    Thanks King Gyros for a great lunch experience.

They also have a good sized menu and everything I've tried has been good sized portions and delicious.
